Class OdsLoadOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gembox.spreadsheet.LoadOptions
      • com.gembox.spreadsheet.OdsLoadOptions

  • public final class OdsLoadOptions
extends LoadOptions
    Represents options for loading from OpenDocument Spreadsheet file format.
    See Also:
    Read Excel file in Java, Convert Excel files to ODS in Java

    • Method Detail

      • isPreserveUnsupportedFeatures

        public boolean isPreserveUnsupportedFeatures()
        Gets a value indicating whether to preserve ODS file format features that are not directly supported through GemBox.Spreadsheet object model.

        Default value is set to true.

        Returns:
        true to preserve ODS file format features that are not directly supported through GemBox.Spreadsheet object model; otherwise, false.

      • isReadDisplayValues

        public boolean isReadDisplayValues()
        Read display values instead of stored values.

        Values in ODS are stored as value - display string pairs. Normally stored value is read but that looses number formatting. If you want to read value as formatted display string (for example, date as "Wednesday, May 5th, 2009" string), set this property to true.

        Default value is set to false.

        Returns:
        true to read display values; otherwise, false.

      • setPreserveUnsupportedFeatures

        public void setPreserveUnsupportedFeatures(boolean preserveUnsupportedFeatures)
        Sets a value indicating whether to preserve ODS file format features that are not directly supported through GemBox.Spreadsheet object model.

        Default value is set to true.

        Parameters:
        preserveUnsupportedFeatures - true to preserve ODS file format features that are not directly supported through GemBox.Spreadsheet object model; otherwise, false.

      • setReadDisplayValues

        public void setReadDisplayValues(boolean readDisplayValues)
        Set to read display values instead of stored values.

        Values in ODS are stored as value - display string pairs. Normally stored value is read but that looses number formatting. If you want to read value as formatted display string (for example, date as "Wednesday, May 5th, 2009" string), set this method to true.

        Default value is set to false.

        Parameters:
        readDisplayValues - true to read display values; otherwise, false.
